Title:
Why Software Repositories Are Not Used For 
    Defect-Insertion Circumstance Analysis More Often: A Case Study
Elements_risk_assessment: trace backwards through the version history to identify for each of these lines the last commit that has changed the line, and
UseOF-SZZ: Mapping defect corrections to defect insertions
Summary: Determine the reasons why DICA is not used more often by practitioners
Outcome:
Current repository mining methods are too immature for
successful DICA. Gradual improvements are unlikely to help; different principles of operation will be required. Even with such
different techniques, issues with input data quality may continue to make good results difficult-to-have
